discussion.content:
reorder policy is order. lot-for-lot is wrong. It will accumulate all quantities in a period into one order.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-US/dynamics365/business-central/design-details-planning-parameters

the requirement says "The item is acquired by purchase specifically for each new instance of demand from an order." so Reordering policy cannot be "Lot-for-lot" which would accumulate different quantities in a period, it should be "Order"

comments.content:
Type: This should be set to "Inventory" since the item is a tangible good with an inventory asset value.

Replenishment System: This should be set to "Purchase" as the item is acquired by purchase for each new instance of demand.

Reordering Policy: This should be set to "Order" since the item is ordered specifically for each new instance of demand from an order. The "Order" reordering policy is used when you want to order items only when there's a demand for them.

discussion.content: the correct answer for reorder is "order"

questions.question_text:
A company uses Dynamics 365 Business Central.
A customer wants to sell items that are not normally counted in the company's warehouse.
You need to configure the system to meet this requirement.
What should you set up?

A company sells and services landscaping equipment.
The company wants to calculate an item's sales unit price based on a flat profit rate of 20 percent.
You need to adjust the item's unit price.
What are two possible ways to achieve the goal? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

comments.content:
can't find the sales price worksheet. 
This page is no longer available. It was used by a feature that has been replaced or removed.
For more information, see Feature Management.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: DE
D. Run the Adjust Item Costs/Prices batch job: This batch job allows you to adjust the unit price for several items at once. You specify an adjustment factor, and the batch job multiplies the current unit price by this factor. This can be used to increase the unit price by a flat profit rate of 20 percent.

E. Configure the unit price by using the Suggest Item Price on Wksh feature: This function creates suggestions for changing the agreed item unit prices for your sales prices based on the unit price on the item cards. You can specify an adjustment factor to increase the item prices by a certain percentage, such as 20 percent.

Selected Answer: BC
The text says "for a specific item", thus I believe configure the unit price on item card is more appropriate than running batch jobs (also you could define the margin of 20% on the card). On the sales price list you could enter the price manually. The batch runs (D,E) do not offer an option to calculate a sales price based on the unit cost to get a flat profit rate of 20 percent...

choices.A: Create a sales job price list for the specific item.
choices.E: Configure the unit price by using the Suggest Item Price on Wksh feature.
choices.D: Run the Adjust Item Costs/Prices batch job.
choices.C: Create a sales price list for the specific item.
choices.B: Configure the unit price on the item card for the item.
